name: URLSessionWebSocketTask.CloseCode
desc: A code that indicates why a WebSocket connection closed.

items.name: case abnormalClosure
items.desc: A reserved code that indicates the connection closed without a close control frame.

items.name: case goingAway
items.desc: A code that indicates an endpoint is going away.

items.name: case internalServerError
items.desc: A code that indicates the server terminated the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition.

items.name: case invalid
items.desc: A code that indicates the connection is still open.

items.name: case invalidFramePayloadData
items.desc: A code that indicates the server terminated the connection because it received data inconsistent with the message’s type.

items.name: case mandatoryExtensionMissing
items.desc: A code that indicates the client terminated the connection because the server didn’t negotiate a required extension.

items.name: case messageTooBig
items.desc: A code that indicates an endpoint is terminating the connection because it received a message too big for it to process.

items.name: case noStatusReceived
items.desc: A reserved code that indicates an endpoint expected a status code and didn’t receive one.

items.name: case normalClosure
items.desc: A code that indicates normal connection closure.

items.name: case policyViolation
items.desc: A code that indicates an endpoint terminated the connection because it received a message that violates its policy.

items.name: case protocolError
items.desc: A code that indicates an endpoint terminated the connection due to a protocol error.

items.name: case tlsHandshakeFailure
items.desc: A reserved code that indicates the connection closed due to the failure to perform a TLS handshake.

items.name: case unsupportedData
items.desc: A code that indicates an endpoint terminated the connection after receiving a type of data it can’t accept.
